Class LevelView

java.lang.Object
Levels.LevelView
Direct Known Subclasses:
LevelViewLevelTwo
public class LevelView extends Object
Represents the view layer of a level, managing the UI elements such as hearts, win image, and game over image. Responsible for updating the visual components as the game progresses.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelView

      public LevelView(javafx.scene.Group root, int heartsToDisplay)
      Constructs a LevelView instance with the specified root group and initial number of hearts.
      Parameters:
      root - the root container of the scene where the UI elements will be added.
      heartsToDisplay - the initial number of hearts to display.

  • Method Details

    • showHeartDisplay

      public void showHeartDisplay()
      Displays the heart display in the scene, showing the player's remaining health. Ensures the heart display is only added once to the root container.

    • showWinImage

      public void showWinImage()
      Displays the win image on the screen when the player wins the level. Ensures the win image is only added once to the root container.

    • showGameOverImage

      public void showGameOverImage()
      Displays the game over image on the screen when the player loses the game. Ensures the game over image is only added once to the root container.

    • removeHearts

      public void removeHearts(int heartsRemaining)
      Removes hearts from the heart display when the player's health decreases.
      Parameters:
      heartsRemaining - the current number of hearts to display after removal.

    • addHearts

      public void addHearts(int heartsRemaining)
      Adds hearts to the heart display when the player's health increases.
      Parameters:
      heartsRemaining - the current number of hearts to display after addition.
